metadata.title: CVE-2024-5564 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in libndp. This flaw allows a local malicioususer to cause a buffer overflow in NetworkManager, triggered by sending amalformed IPv6 router advertisement packet. This issue occurred as libndpwas not correctly validating the route length information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-5564` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libndp-tools - 1.6-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libndp0 - 1.6-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libndp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
